Package io.github.ai4ci.abm

Interface SocialRelationship

All Superinterfaces:
Serializable
@Immutable public interface SocialRelationship extends Serializable
Represents a weighted social relationship (an edge) between two individuals in the simulation's social network. This immutable value object stores the strength of the relationship and the identifiers of the two people involved. It provides methods to calculate the probability of contact based on individual mobility and to retrieve the associated Person objects. This class is Serializable for persistence.

  • Method Details

    • contactProbability

      default double contactProbability(double adjMobility1, double adjMobility2)
      Calculates the probability of a contact occurring between the two individuals in this relationship, adjusted by their respective mobility factors. The calculation is getRelationshipStrength() * adjMobility1 * adjMobility2.
      Parameters:
      adjMobility1 - The adjusted mobility factor of the first participant.
      adjMobility2 - The adjusted mobility factor of the second participant.
      Returns:
      The probability of contact, a double value.

    • getPeopleIds

      it.unimi.dsi.fastutil.ints.IntIntImmutableSortedPair getPeopleIds()
      Returns an immutable sorted pair of integer IDs representing the two individuals involved in this social relationship. The IDs are sorted to ensure that the relationship is uniquely identified regardless of the order of participants.
      Returns:
      An IntIntImmutableSortedPair containing the IDs of the two people.

    • getRelationshipStrength

      double getRelationshipStrength()
      The significance or strength of the relationship, expressed as a probability or quantile. This value represents the likelihood that a contact will occur between two maximally mobile participants. A value close to 1 indicates a strong, close relationship with a high probability of contact, while a value near 0 signifies an improbable or weak connection.
      Returns:
      The strength of the social relationship, a double between 0 and 1.

    • getSource

      default Person getSource(Outbreak outbreak)
      Retrieves the Person object corresponding to the source (first) individual in this relationship. The source is determined by the first ID in the sorted pair.
      Parameters:
      outbreak - The Outbreak instance from which to retrieve the person.
      Returns:
      The Person object for the source individual.
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if the person with the source ID is not found in the outbreak.

    • getTarget

      default Person getTarget(Outbreak outbreak)
      Retrieves the Person object corresponding to the target (second) individual in this relationship. The target is determined by the second ID in the sorted pair.
      Parameters:
      outbreak - The Outbreak instance from which to retrieve the person.
      Returns:
      The Person object for the target individual.
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if the person with the target ID is not found in the outbreak.
